bill.title: Elections; require electors to present certain types of identification before being allowed to vote.
bill.description: An Act To Require Persons Who Appear To Vote In Person At A Polling Place Or The Registrar's Office To Identify Themselves By Presenting Certain Types Of Identification To An Election Manager Or The Registrar Before They Are Allowed To Vote; To Provide For The Issuance Of A Mississippi Voter Identification Card Free Of Charge To Qualified Electors Who Do Not Have A Valid Mississippi Driver's License Or Identification Card; To Provide That Such Card Shall Be Valid Only As Identification For Voting Purposes; To Amend Sections 23-15-11, 23-15-541 And 23-15-719, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.
